And '0' means a network-fetch attempt wasn't even made for the URI.

Seeing -50, -5000, 0 in crawl.log is suggestive of some significant 
customization of the crawl scoping or processor chain, in a way that has 
prevented usual/necessary steps from happening.

Suggestion for miro786: start with a default configuration, and make 
incremental changes, testing each step of the way. At least then you'll 
know which latest change went awry.

- Gordon @ IA

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> You can check the fetch status codes in the glossary:
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/glossary.html
> (Scroll a little down the page)
> 
> -50 means waiting for a precondition (DNS / robots.txt)
> -5000 means out of scope and scope changed
> 
> I can't figure out what happend - maybe try and post your order.xml to the list
> 
> best
